kuusisto.simpool

Class Pool<T extends Poolable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • kuusisto.simpool.Pool<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The Poolable type that the Pool holds.

    public class Pool<T extends Poolable>
extends Object
    The Pool class is used for the actual pooling of Poolable objects. A Pool must be provided with a PoolableFactory for its Poolable type, can be given an initial size, and can be limited in the number of allocations that it is allowed to make.
    Author:
    Finn Kuusisto

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int NO_LIMIT 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pool(PoolableFactory<T> factory)
      Create a new empty Pool with no limit on the number of allocations that it can make.
      Pool(PoolableFactory<T> factory, int startSize)
      Create a new Pool with an initial number of instances and no limit on the number of allocations that it can make.
      Pool(PoolableFactory<T> factory, int startSize, int maxAllocate)
      Create a new Pool with an initial number of instances and a limit on the number of allocations that it can make.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T get()
      Get an instance from the Pool.
      T get(boolean quietError)
      Get an instance from the Pool, with the option of returning null instead of throwing a SimpoolException on error.

      Give an instance to the Pool.

        public static final int NO_LIMIT

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pool

        public Pool(PoolableFactory<T> factory)
     throws SimpoolException
        Create a new empty Pool with no limit on the number of allocations that it can make.
        Parameters:
        factory - a PoolableFactory to create the desired Poolable type
        Throws:
        SimpoolException - if factory is null

      • Pool

        public Pool(PoolableFactory<T> factory,
    int startSize)
     throws SimpoolException
        Create a new Pool with an initial number of instances and no limit on the number of allocations that it can make.
        Parameters:
        factory - a PoolableFactory to create the desired Poolable type
        startSize - the initial number of Poolable instances to allocate
        Throws:
        SimpoolException - if factory is null

      • Pool

        public Pool(PoolableFactory<T> factory,
    int startSize,
    int maxAllocate)
     throws SimpoolException
        Create a new Pool with an initial number of instances and a limit on the number of allocations that it can make.
        Parameters:
        factory - a PoolableFactory to create the desired Poolable type
        startSize - the initial number of Poolable instances to allocate, up to maxAllocate
        maxAllocate - the maximum number of Poolable instances this Pool is allowed to make (non-positive assumed to be NO_LIMIT)
        Throws:
        SimpoolException - if factory is null

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public T get()
                       throws SimpoolException
        Get an instance from the Pool.
        Returns:
        an instance from this Pool
        Throws:
        SimpoolException - if no more instances are available and maximum number of allocations has been reached

      • get

        public T get(boolean quietError)
                       throws SimpoolException
        Get an instance from the Pool, with the option of returning null instead of throwing a SimpoolException on error.
        Parameters:
        quietError - true if null should be returned on error instead of throwing a SimpoolException
        Returns:
        an instance from this Pool
        Throws:
        SimpoolException - if no more instances are available, maximum number of allocations has been reached, and quietError is false

      • give

        public void give(T object)
        Give an instance to the Pool. This should normally be done with instances that were originally retrieved from the Pool, but may be done with instances allocated elsewhere. This can allow you to overfill the Pool past the maximum allocation limit.
        Parameters:
        object - the instance to return to the pool (will be reset)
